intro: Tetracera rugosa, commonly known as the rough-leaved tetracera, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its rough, textured leaves. The plant produces small, clustered yellowish flowers that are often surrounded by modified leaves called bracts. Tetracera rugosa is typically found in forest understories and thrives in humid, shaded environments. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for botanical studies and ecological research.
